title: Davidvictorson
author: Davidvictorson
content: Some days ago the National Identity Commission through the Federal Ministry of Communications and Digital Economy published this circular.See The summary is that Nigerians who have a NIN will now be able to generate a virtual NIN for any transaction that requires the individual to provide their NIN. Why? It's simple. Formerly, when you supply your NIN on any transaction, it is stored by the organization  or business entity which is raises a lot of security concerns as it is possible that your personal information can be stolen and used for other mischievous vices. With the provision of the virtual NIN, you generate a number that can be used only once, your details cannot be stored by the organization or business entity. The mechanism of action is just like how a bank token works(not totally but you get the idea)What do Nigerians think? Personally, I think this is a welcomed development and we should commend the government on this. PS: Make una no vex about the picture arrangement I never sabi how to put am next to each other  You fit suggest am to me.

comments.author: Agbe
comments.body: Well na u know how di pictures appear in di site so di wey u present it na di way we go take am. Dis na very gud development, 4rom NIC. Den dat mean dem go give di tokenization devices so we gede use am generate di token anytime we wan use di NIN. But di major problem wey I dey get with dem na di moni wey Dem dey collect 4 di registration process. Employment dem no dey do, nd some national benefits wey we supposed enjoy sef e no dey. We just need good governance.Ur picture size is large so u fit reduce am small like 200 weigh and height

comments.author: CryptopreneurBrainboss
comments.body: Quote from: Davidvictorson on December 29, 2022, 06:11:36 AM  PS: Make una no vex about the picture arrangement I never sabi how to put am next to each other  You fit suggest am to me.No issue that's why we needed a board like this as e help you learn some kind things make you no go outside they look like novice when you get better rank wey be say you supposed dun sabi some kind things by that rank. On way to learn for this forum na to quote wetin person do and look how him take do am. You fit use table run this matter or just reduced the size and keep the images close to each other.For the matter, personally I no understand why platforms dey request for our BVN when dem know say na very sensitive information be dat and dem dey store am for centralized platforms wey dem fit hack. I like this new innovation as e go help reduce some kind thief wey dey happen when people wey understand how to use ur BVN get am. Or better still make dem pass better law wey no go require financial platforms to dey request for our BVN, make dem just find another way to dey verify our information.

comments.author: Obari
comments.body: This matter na really nice one and I really love how the government take arrange this matter because to me, this na one major thing we government don do to help secure the safety of the common man from internet bullies and criminals.With this very initiative by the government, I believe say plenty things go really work straight and we go dey more at a safer place but I also think say government really need to publicize this matter and help create major awareness ASAP.

comments.author: Asiska02
comments.body: Wow this is a great development and a welcome one too. When I first saw the title of the topic, I assumed the government wants to be taxing people using NIN, lol not until I read the full gist. I think this little things the government are doing to make Nigeria a more secured place for us and a fraud/crime free nation is something we should appreciate them for. The little things matter and we’ve to start somewhere to get to our promise land of a more secured and developed country.
